translation: Good afternoon everyone.
transcript: 大家下午好。

translation: My name is Zhu Ye.
transcript: 呃我叫朱晔。

translation: My major is architecture, so the theme I’m going to share with you this afternoon is "the secret of streets and the possibility of public art".
transcript: 实际上我自己读的是建筑，所以今天下午跟大家分享的主题叫“街道的秘密和公共艺术的可能”。

translation: Streets are actually a public space that we are familiar with and an important form of public space.
transcript: 那么街道呢，实际上是我们耳熟能详的一种公共空间，是一个重要的公共空间的形式。

translation: In a nutshell, as Jane Jacobs says.
transcript: 所以我就用一句话哈，雅格布森说的。

translation: "Streets and their sidewalks, the main public places of a city, are its most vital organs. "
transcript: 说街道及其人行道是城市中主要的公共区域，是一个城市里面最重要的这么一个器官，对吧。

translation: Let me start by showing some pictures of streets in our daily life.
transcript: 那么我们首先来看一下我们日常生活的街道。

translation: This picture is actually the Shanghai streetscape, right?
transcript: 这张图片实际上是上海的场景，对吧。

translation: You can see just from these pictures that streets are actually a mix of traffic and all sorts of things.
transcript: 大家就看图片，自己都可以感知一下，就它实际上是一个呃交通和各种的东西混合在一起，对吧。

translation: Streets have various names and every street has its own name.
transcript: 街道也会有各式各样的命名，对吧，每条街道都会有自己的名字。

translation: For example, the names of Shanghai streets contain all Chinese cities’ names.
transcript: 你像上海的街道命名的特点，就把全国都装在它的这个地图里面了，装在街里面了，对吧。

translation: Streets also form different communities, alleys and lanes.
transcript: 那么街道同时也会形成不同的社区，啊会成形成巷子、啊里弄，对吧。

translation: Which are presented in their own unique ways in different cities.
transcript: 有各式各样的方式，在各个城市有各式各样的方式啊。

translation: With people coming and going, bustling streets actually become flowing spaces.
transcript: 那么当然街道上因为人来人往，所以街道实际是一个流动的空间。

translation: Containing traffic flow, people flow, logistics and information flow, all of which constitute the streets in our daily life.
transcript: 有车流、人流、物流、信息流，对吧，这样构成了我们街道的日常。

translation: Streets are also the carrier of various businesses.
transcript: 那么包括在街道上有各式各样、各种等级的商业。

translation: Such as shopping malls, pedestrian streets, general vendors, markets, etc.
transcript: 包括有shopping mall，有呃步行街，对吧，也有一般的摊贩，有一般的市场等等啊。

translation: Of course, there is another side of streets, a side from the top down where lots of bottom up stuff resides.
transcript: 那么当然街道的另一面就是在呃就自上而下的另一面，它会有很多自下而上的东西。

translation: Such stuff, we often call informal, shows a spontaneous form.
transcript: 那么这种东西我们往往把它称作informal，就是一种自发的形态，对吧。

translation: Which means that we can make use of all possible spaces appropriately, such as the two sides of sidewalks, overpasses and so on.
transcript: 就是自己适时地去利用各式各样的可能的空间，包括人行道的边上，包括过街的天桥等等之类的，对吧。

translation: Some of the more important places in streets will be pedestrianized, to which only pedestrians have access.
transcript: 那么包括街道也会更主要的，它有些地方会开辟出来，成为一个步行的街道，啊就只能够给步行者使用。

translation: Meanwhile, streets are filled with advertisements.
transcript: 那么同时它也充斥着各式各样的广告，对吧。

translation: Including audio-visual and other forms of advertisements.
transcript: 声光电，各式各样的视觉形态的广告。

translation: There are also various information and written messages presented on streets.
transcript: 那么街上面还会有各式各样的信息，也会有各式各样的自发的信息，对吧。

translation: Such as information for rent and messages related to old traditions.
transcript: 大家看到有各种招租的，啊甚至留言，啊也包括有跟以前的传统有关的。

translation: Meanwhile, as urban spaces themselves are graded, streets will naturally be ranked  during the development of cities.
transcript: 那么街道同时它一定是有等级的，因为我们的城市空间本身它就已经是有等级的这么一个空间，对吧，各种城市在发展的过程中，它自然地就形成了这么一个梯度。

translation: Also, streets need to be cleaned daily, so they are public spaces for daily use.
transcript: 同时街道也需要不停地日常的清洁，所以它是一个日常的公共空间。

translation: What’s more, we can see children on streets.
transcript: 我们看到对吧，啊更多的呢在街道上面我们看到会有小朋友。

translation: They may regard streets as a place to play games. We also see people of different ages are using streets.
transcript: 有不同的年龄的人都在使用街道，啊，小朋友有可能把它当做一个游戏的地方，把它当做一个游戏玩耍的场所啊。

translation: including the elderly, who have to communicate, interact and chat with others.
transcript: 那么包括我们啊老年人，他也要利用街道啊，他们要在街上公共地进行交流和交往对吧，去聊天。

translation: We all need to go out for a walk, such as students who fall in love.
transcript: 大家也会去逛街对吧，大家包括很多同学们谈恋爱对吧，

translation: They  stroll down the street instead of always staying on campus.
transcript: 老在校园里待着不是事，得去逛街啊。

translation: All these are our daily life.
transcript: 那么这是表明了这些部分啊都表明了我们日常的这么一种状态。

translation: We can stand or take a standard posture called Chinese squat on the street to chat with others.
transcript: 包括在街上可以交谈，对吧，大家都会有一种标准的姿势，叫中国蹲，对吧，大家蹲着交谈对吧，站着交谈等等之类的啊，可以去聊天，说话啊。

translation: If you are tired when walking on the street, you can rest on the street.
transcript: 所以是包括街上也是累了你就可以在街上休息对吧。

translation: In fact, there is such a possibility, right?
transcript: 实际上也有这样的可能。

translation: If not, you can use other facilities on the street to have a rest.
transcript: 如果没有这种可能，你就去利用街上的其他的设施，你去休息对吧。

translation: Thus it can be seen that streets have the closest relationship with human body.
transcript: 就是人的实际大家看到，在街道上实际上是人的身体，跟它的关系是最紧密的对吧。

translation: After all, it's people who are using the street.
transcript: 因为毕竟这是我们的人，我们自己在使用这个街道，是这么一种状态。

translation: At night, we can see different street scenes which can’t be seen in the daytime.
transcript: 啧所以除了有白天之外，还有夜晚对吧，在夜晚我们可以看到更多的街道的状况，实际上是在白天日常情况下看不到的。

translation: They are a part of our daily life.
transcript: 这是我们日常的这么一个部分。

translation: But what has changed in our city?
transcript: 但是我们的城市发生了什么变化？

translation: This is data from 2011.
transcript: 这是11年的数据啊。

translation: Now the urbanization rate has reached 53% or even higher.
transcript: 现在已经我们的城市化率已经到53%的左右了哈，甚至更高。

translation: More than 50% people have already lived in cities.
transcript: 那么实际上说就有50%多的人，已经生活在城市里面了。

translation: This is the so-called urbanization rate.
transcript: 这就叫城市化率这么一个概念。

translation: Urbanization is actually a flow and convergence of various elements.
transcript: 啊城市化实际上就是各种要素的一个流动和汇聚。

translation: With the development of urbanization, elements such as people flow, logistics, information flow, and wealth are rapidly gathering in cities.
transcript: 啊如果城市的发展实际上包括人流、物流、信息流，啊包括财富等等之类的对吧。

translation: How do these elements come together?
transcript: 那么这些要素如何汇聚呢？

translation: It is actually achieved by making differences.
transcript: 实际上是通过差异的制造。

translation: China was on a very even footing of development 30 years ago.
transcript: 因为中国以前的在前30年的基础，是一个很平均的这么一个状态。

translation: It is the differential development strategy that has produced today's cities and various urban agglomerations.
transcript: 那么这样一个差异化制造出了我们今天的城市，对吧，有各式各样的城市群。

translation: Which are mainly distributed in the Yangtze River Delta, the Pearl River Delta, and the Bohai rim.
transcript: 最主要的在长三角、珠三角、环渤海啊这样的地方。

translation: To develop public transport, these cities have to build ring roads, constantly expanding the city scale.
transcript: 那么也会在城市里面，为了发展公共交城市交通对吧，城市越来越大，那么就修了很多的环对吧。

translation: For example, Beijing has already built the sixth ring road.
transcript: 那北京修到6环了啊。

translation: In this way, our past mode of life was changed.
transcript: 那么这样一来实际上我们以往的生活模式就被打破了。

translation: What kind of mode?
transcript: 那么这个打破是什么呢？

translation: It's the way people used to live in the planned economy era in China, known as the unit model.
transcript: 就以往在计划经济时代，中国的大家的生活模式呢是什么，是叫做单位模式。

translation: Under such a model, the places where people live is related to their jobs.
transcript: 就说你的工作地点和你的居住地点是合一的，对吧。

translation: Their public life was under the supervision and observation of others.
transcript: 大家住在一个大院里面,啊大家的公共生活是在别人的监视和观察之下的这么一个公共生活对吧。

translation: There were various living facilities in such compounds.
transcript: 在这个大院里面什么都有。

translation: Including hospitals, primary schools, kindergartens, canteens, cinemas, swimming pools, etc.
transcript: 啊什么医院，啊从小学、幼儿园，啊到食堂，到电影院啊，到游泳池等等都在这里面解决对吧。

translation: But actually, this kind of compounds and spatial model in China disintegrated with the advent of the commodity society.
transcript: 但是大院的这个东西，实际上是随着季这个商品社会到来，在中国这种模式是被解体的啊，这种空间模式是解体的。

translation: What we get instead are residential quarters as the picture shows.
transcript: 那么取而代之的大家看到就是这样的一个小区对吧。

translation: These residential quarters are often large-size and large-scale.
transcript: 而且这种小区其实尺度规模都非常大。

translation: Since 1998, China has entered the era of residential commercialization on a large scale.
transcript: 那1998年之后其实中国就大面积地进入了这个住宅商品化的时代。

translation: There are pictures of different residential quarters in the world.
transcript: 那么大家看看这是各地不同的这样的小区，对吧。

translation: These dark-colored on the left are foreign residential quarters.
transcript: 左边的这个黑的都是国国外的。

translation: Actually, they are blocks.
transcript: 啊但实际上是街区。

translation: All these pictures are in the same proportion.
transcript: 大家看这个概念是街区对吧，这同比例的图。

translation: These on the right are Chinese residential quarters.
transcript: 右边是我们中国的小区。

translation: Moreover, we can see that Chinese residential quarters are actually closed and capital-admitted with an access control system.
transcript: 而且我们可以看到，这种小区实际上是封闭式的吧，对吧，而且是资本准入式的，所以它是有门禁系统的。

translation: And there are only one or two entrances in such a large area.
transcript: 于是这么一来，这么大的一个区域就只有1到2个入口。

translation: People won't go there if they don't live there.
transcript: 而且平时其实大家如果不是在这儿居住人就不会去，对吧。

translation: In fact, the commercialization of housing in China has destroyed the original urban mechanism, such as the block mechanism showed in the left picture.
transcript: 那么实际上中国的这种住宅商品化，实际上就使得原有的这么一个城市的机理哈，像这种像左边这种有街区的机理，实际上是得到了实际上是一种破坏。

translation: Moreover, the relationship between the residential area and the city is actually negative.
transcript: 而且这种居住区跟城市的关系，实际上是显现出一种消极的关系。

translation: Such commercialization of housing since 1998 has also brought about a major change.
transcript: 那么另外一个呢，这么一种住宅商品化，从98年以来住宅商品化,带来一个变化就叫做。

translation: The separation of residence areas and work places.
transcript: 这主要的就是居住地和和这个工作地的这么一个分离。

translation: This separation leads to people starting to buy vehicles, and the city scale has been continuously expanding.
transcript: 这么一分离之后，那么也促使另一个消费的发生，那么就是买车，对吧，那么这个城市就开始不断不断地就呃胀起来了对吧。

translation: Living in a residential quarter like this, you don't know who your neighbors are, do you?
transcript: 包括在这样一个小区里面，大家住着的你也不认识你的邻居是谁，对吧。

translation: Unlike in the compound, you know all your neighbors.
transcript: 在以前大院模式里，你都认识，对吧。

translation: You know Zhang San, Li Si, and even the Master Wang in next door.
transcript: 张三、李四 、王师傅啊，隔壁王师傅都是认识。

translation: But in the new residential quarter, you may have lived for years without knowing one of your next-door neighbors.
transcript: 但是在新的这个小区里面，你可能住了很多年，不知道隔壁邻居是谁。

translation: The only thing you know is that your neighbors probably have a similar income level like you.
transcript: 你知道的只有一件事情，就是他他可能经济水平跟你差不多。

translation: Because they can buy a house about the same size as yours at the same price and live next to you.
transcript: 因为他能够用同样的价钱，跟你买跟你们家差不多大的这么一个房子，对吧，住在你旁边。

translation: So let's take a look at a few pictures here.
transcript: 所以我们看看这里面几张图。

translation: They are about the changes of Chongqing in 1944 and 1993 when this city developed slowly.
transcript: 啊这是重庆的变化啊，那么44年的重庆和93年的重庆，这个城市在慢慢地发展，对吧。

translation: The area in the middle is Yuzhong District.
transcript: 中间的那块是渝中区，啊。

translation: The city of Chongqing, sandwiched between two valleys and mountains.
transcript: 那么重庆城市因为是夹在山里面，两个山谷之间。

translation: Has developed from the north to the south since it upgraded its status to a municipality in 1997.
transcript: 所以它是先南北长，啊从97直辖开始，它就开始南北长。

translation: By 2012, its urban scale had been expanding, even exceeding the scale reached in its north-south development.
transcript: 那么慢慢地逐渐到了12年的时候就一直膨胀，膨胀到后面甚至超出了这个。

translation: Because of the possibility of public transport, numerous tunnels have been opened and the city has been expanding to such a scale.
transcript: 因为公共交通的可能性啊，它打通了隧道，一直就胀到现在的大概的这样的一个模式。

translation: But what is the major addition that actually contributes to the scale today?
transcript: 但是在这样的一个模式里面，实际上最主要的增加是什么的增加呢？

translation: It is the increase of road networks.
transcript: 最主要的增加是车行体系的增加。

translation: Due to the large city network, the city achieves expansion by firstly completing the accessibility of vehicles.
transcript: 因为城市网络太大，铺张哈，或者说它的扩张，它首先是把这个车行的网络，可达性先去完成。

translation: This is a group of photos by Ya Niu called "So Near, and yet So Far".
transcript: 所以看到这个是亚牛的一组照片叫“这么近，那么远”啊。

translation: Seeing from the photo, we seem to be very close to the city.
transcript: 就我们看着很近。

translation: But the city actually provides services for vehicles.
transcript: 但这个城市实际上是为车服务的啊。

translation: Vehicles are very far from our body, because they are something that wraps our body inside.
transcript: 但是车离我们的身体是很远的，因为车是把我们的身体包裹在里面的一个东西对吧。

translation: Similarly, we live in such model-like residential quarters in the photo.
transcript: 我们就住在这样一种很很像模型一样的景观小区里面啊。

translation: Once I went to Spain myself.
transcript: 那么于是有一次我自己呃去西班牙。

translation: This is a picture of Barcelona, and the green road in the middle is Rambla.
transcript: 啊这是巴塞罗那的一个图啊，中间绿色的那条路叫Rambla大街。

translation: This was my first trip to Spain.
transcript: 于是我就第一次去，我也是第一次去西班牙。

translation: But I found this street was highly recognizable and I got a conceptual anchor point which was proposed by Kevin Lynch in his book The Image of the City.
transcript: 但是去西班牙的时候，当这条街的识别性非常高，啊识别性非常高的时候，实际上实际上我就获得了一个锚点，啊这是凯文林奇在他的《城市意象》里面提供的一个概念对吧。

translation: That is to say I take this street as my first and the whole identification point in the city.
transcript: 等于说我有第一个识别点，我就把这条街当做我的一个整个的识别点。

translation: So what makes this street different?
transcript: 这个街为什么不一样呢？

translation: Look at the picture on the left.
transcript: 大家看左边那张大图是这条街啊。

translation: It's the street Rambla, and its car lanes are spread out on both sides where one way drive is required.
transcript: 这条街是把汽车的车行挤在两边的，啊两边只能通通单行的通车，单向通车。

translation: However, the whole middle of the street is actually for pedestrians.
transcript: 然后中间的整个的地方，实际上是给大家步行的地方。

translation: There are cafes, food and beverage outlets, newspaper stands, and chairs for rest in the walking area of the street.
transcript: 那么步行的地方上面有咖啡厅，啊啊包括有有些餐饮，有书报亭，有休息的椅子。

translation: That is to say such a large area in the middle of the street serves as a park with markets nearby.
transcript: 等于这条街的整个的中间，这么宽的地方，就像一个公园一样，包括旁边还有市场等等之类的。

translation: So the street is easy for me to recognize when I first went there as an out-of-town stranger.
transcript: 所以这条街就成为我第一次作为一个外地陌生人到那里非常好识别的一个地方。

translation: Then I just walked around the square.
transcript: 于是我围着这个广场在旁边转圈儿。

translation: No matter how I walked around, I could always find the street and avoid getting lost.
transcript: 啊那么怎么转，我都能够找回到这条街上来，于是也就不会迷路。

translation: So I quickly built up a sense of familiarity with this strange city.
transcript: 很快地就建立了一个对陌生城市的这么一个熟悉感，啊。

translation: In fact, everyone can know a public space, a city and a place through his perception of streets.
transcript: 这个实际上是作为每一个人，都会通过他的感知，去了解一个公共空间，了解一个城市的一个方式，是吧，是通过街道去了解的对这个地方。

translation: On both sides of Rambla, there are many small corners and squares where streets meet for people lingering around.
transcript: 所以在这个Rambla大街的两边，还有非常多的这样的一个呃因为街道跟街道一汇聚就会形成小的拐角、小的广场这样的地方，对吧，有很多这样的广场可以驻留。

translation: I can go back to street anyway.
transcript: 驻留了我转一圈儿诶又回来了，转一圈儿又回来了。

translation: So I'm not afraid to get lost.
transcript: 所以我也不怕自己迷路，是这么一个状态。

translation: As a tourist, I was thinking, this is a tourist street.
transcript: 于是我就在想，啧因为我毕竟是个游客嘛，那么而且那条街是条旅游的街。

translation: So what about the other streets in Barcelona?
transcript: 那么巴塞罗那其它的街道是怎么样子呢？

translation: So I walked around the city again during my itinerary and found streets here were very interesting.
transcript: 于是那些天就又在城市里面转，我发现它们的街都很有意思。

translation: Many crawler lanes are specially built on one side of these streets, while another side is for fast traffic.
transcript: 因为它们的街特意地设了很多的社区的这种慢行街道，也就说单向是可以快速通车的，在另一个方向是慢行的。

translation: This layout is actually much like the scaled-down version of Rambla.
transcript: 然后他们的方式实际上很像缩小版的Rambla大街。

translation: Putting public spaces in the middle of the street and car lanes on both sides.
transcript: 也就说把公共空间给放在马路的中间，然后旁边是缓行的通车。

translation: I suddenly felt there was something different.
transcript: 那么这种方式我突然感觉到嘶好像不大一样。

translation: Because as a walker, I only walked and didn't drive in this city, and I felt my body was comfortable here.
transcript: 因为我作为一个步行，我只会步行对吧，那么也没有在那边开车，那么我觉得诶好像我的身体在这里觉得很舒服。

translation: I do feel it and it doesn't need to be told.
transcript: 因为这个不需要别人告诉我，对吧。

translation: As an individual, I strolled around the city and felt really good.
transcript: 那么我作为我个体，我在里面游游逛逛，我觉得非常地爽。

translation: That's what it's like.
transcript: 就这么一种感觉啊。

translation: So I thought about my home in Guangzhou and felt it very troublesome.
transcript: 于是我回想我自己的家，我自己家在广州啊，我觉得啧在广州就很麻烦啊。

translation: There is a stadium next to our home called Yanzigang Stadium.
transcript: 在广州我们家旁边有一个体育场，叫燕子岗体育场，啊。

translation: Nearby residents can find no other public spaces, so they, especially at night, have no choice but to take walks in the stadium.
transcript: 那么尤其到了晚上，大家找不到其他的公共空间，于是这个体育场，实际上是大家都在里面走路，对吧。

translation: When I became a father, I would walk here with my stroller in the evenings when I was free.
transcript: 尤其当我当了爸爸之后，我基本上只要有空，晚上也推着小孩在里面走。

translation: In this stadium, there is basically no space for running at night.
transcript: 基本上在这个体育场里面，晚上是没法跑步的。

translation: That is to say, our city lacks public spaces.
transcript: 也就说实际上在我们城市里面，这个公共空间是基本上缺失的。

translation: Another place I would like to take my child is Wankeli, a commercial space next to my home, featuring a large area.
transcript: 还有一个我愿意带孩子去的地方，实际上是一个商业空间，对吧，在我们家旁边叫万科里，有一个比较多的地方。

translation: Then I doubt whether the streets are really built for us?
transcript: 那么实际上回过头，我就开始在想，这个街道到底是属于我们大家的吗，对吧？

translation: When thinking about it, I find that streets, as a public space, do not belong to anyone.
transcript: 实际上想来想去，我觉得街道作为一个公共空间，不是属于大家的啊。

translation: But to various units, as there are a lot of units  managing them.
transcript: 它属于很多的各式各样的单位，对吧，在一条街道上有非常多的单位可以去管它。

translation: For example, of the manhole covers and various pipe holes dug in the streets.
transcript: 在街道上也挖了很多的井盖，各式各样的管孔，对吧。

translation: Some may be used for telecommunications, some for the network, and others for televisions.
transcript: 它们有的可能属于电信，有的可能属于网络，对吧，有的可能属于其他的电视等等谁啊等等。

translation: Therefore, Chinese streets are actually divided.
transcript: 所以在一条中国的一条街道上，它实际上是分裂的啊。

translation: As a real public space, streets actually have not been taken seriously.
transcript: 所以作为街道作为一个真正的公共空间，实际上并没有被得到一个重视。

translation: So I wonder is there any other possibility for such an important public space?
transcript: 于是我就想这样一种重要的公共空间，有没有其他的可能呢？

translation: Once I saw Running Man, an interesting Korean variety show.
transcript: 那么有一次我就看到一个有趣的这个综艺节目，韩国的综艺节目叫《Running man》，啊。

translation: In this show, all members play games in the public spaces in various cities.
transcript: 他们里面实际上就是，让自己在城市里面的各种公共空间里面做游戏。

translation: The screenshot here is the episode in Hong Kong.
transcript: 啊这里截的图是其中的一集。

translation: They play games inside the Central-Mid-Levels Escalators in the Central district.
transcript: 他们在香港，利用那个呃中环的半山扶梯在里面做游戏，啊。

translation: People have places in a city to play games, suggesting a high affinity between human body and the city.
transcript: 那么人的身体能够在城市里面做游戏，实际上这个时候身体跟城市的亲和度就非常高的，对吧。

translation: This is an interesting case of the possibility to use the city public space.
transcript: 它对整个公共空间应用的可能性，也是一种非常有趣的应用啊。

translation: So is there any other possibility?
transcript: 那么还有其他的可能吗？

translation: Then I kept looking for and found this, Madrid RIO.
transcript: 于是就接着就去找，啊那么这是其中另一个案例，叫马德里RIO。

translation: In fact, this is a ring road constructed around the city of Madrid.
transcript: 实际上这个是马德里建了一个，也是建了一个环城的那个环道啊。

translation: After the completion of the ring road, the builders found that the road isolated the traffic on both sides.
transcript: 建完这个环道之后，他们觉得不对，建完了环道之后，一个是这个环道一建，就隔绝了两边的交通啊。

translation: And it would take more time for outside people to enter the city.
transcript: 第二一个实际上让这边的人进城反而会更慢。

translation: So they came up with an idea, spending huge sums on flattening the ring road into a square and making vehicles go underground.
transcript: 于是他们想了个办法啊，花巨资把这个环道，就是整个的平整为广场，让那些车呢穿地下走。

translation: In this way, dozens of parks and hotels were newly opened in this city.
transcript: 那么这样一来，在这个城市里面就多了好几十个公园啊，多了好多的甚至酒店。

translation: And the walking distance from the new urban zone to the old town has also been greatly shortened, which actually increases a possibility of the public space.
transcript: 那么包括从这个新城区步行进老城区的距离，也大大地缩短，啊实际上是提升了一种公共空间的可能。

translation: Well-known examples also include the High Line Park in the United States, a recreational park where people can rest and relax. It is actually transformed from abandoned railway tracks.
transcript: 那么包括当然著名的例子呀，也包括美国的这个高线公园是吧，实际上是把废弃的一个这个铁轨，建成了一个大家可以休息、休闲的这么一个公园。

translation: Another example I like very much is architect Liu Jiakun's work West Village, a doughnut-shaped courtyard.
transcript: 那么包括呃呃我们比较喜欢的一个作品啊，这刘家琨做的西村大院，对吧，它也是一个回形结构的。

translation: In the midst of the courtyard are many sideways.
transcript: 那么中间建了很多步行的网道。

translation: Which actually form a community service center, a large community service complex.
transcript: 它实际上是一个社区的服务中心，大的社区服务综合体，对吧。

translation: Commercial spaces are located on both sides of these sideways and at the outermost of the courtyard, making room for other subspaces and walking spaces.
transcript: 那么两边是商业，啊围在最外面是商业，那么里面有非常多的步行的可能，有很多的其他的次空间。

translation: It can be seen that as a comprehensive building, it has such possibilities.
transcript: 那么作为一个综合性的建筑，也能够这么做，对吧。

translation: This is Tentacle Park, the design of which was based on the study of Shabei Street, Shazheng Street in Chongqing.
transcript: 那么包括这个案例，咱们做重庆沙正街、沙北街的一个研究，那最后这是我们的成果啊，做了一个触角公园。

translation: By elevating the ground we build a public park that is connected with surrounding buildings.
transcript: 就是说通过把整个的地皮抬高，然后让它能够不光形成公园，还能够跟周边的建筑，可以一直连接在一起，啊。

translation: Our city has a lot to do with walkers, with our bodies.
transcript: 就我们的城市，本来其实跟大量的步行者，跟我们的身体是有关系的。

translation: However, once the city gives the priority to vehicles and traffic.
transcript: 但是当车行优先体系一旦树立啊确立之后。

translation: Streets would be separated and the two sides of the streets become visible but untouchable.
transcript: 当城市的所有的街道都是被区划的这种交通所优先之后，那么街的两边，就变成可望不可及的了。

translation: People need to get to another side by crossing overpasses or underpasses.
transcript: 大家只能很费力地去爬这个天桥，或者钻下面，是吧。

translation: This is hard for the elderly or for everyone when there are no escalators.
transcript: 这个对于老人家，或者说没有自动扶梯的时候，是尤其难受的一个事情，啊，实际上就针对这样的情况。

translation: In fact, people have rich life on both sides of the street.
transcript: 但是在街两边的，实际上生活实际上是非常丰富的，对吧。

translation: The spaces behind mountainous area in Chongqing are very interesting.
transcript: 大家看这个重庆的山地后面地形非常有趣对吧。

translation: People like to live in somewhere behind the main street for there are lots of spaces.
transcript: 他们的居住都在这个主街的背后展开，有非常多的空间。

translation: Sometimes, they even use a little public space under the tree to do housework, making the city squares on the main street empty.
transcript: 甚至包括他们有些时候，日常就在街上面，利用树下面的一点点公共空间，就开始处理自己的家事儿啊这样的一个方式，啊但是这个广场就会显得非常的空，啊是这样的。

translation: Then we proposed the plan of Tentacle Park.
transcript: 啧所以我们当时也就想了一个方案。

translation: Which may share some similarities with the High Line Park, but more interesting.
transcript: 这个方案跟高线公园的形态有点类似啊。

translation: First, it deals with the problem how to provide a public space that does not conflict with the road network.
transcript: 但是它做的可能其它的就更加的呃有趣一些，因为它首先的应对的，还是跟车行系统不冲突的这么一个问题，对吧，提供了这么一种嘁公共空间的可能。

translation: Second, it is expected to create more spaces.
transcript: 那么更多的呢，它能塑造出更多的空间来。

translation: In the mountainous terrain, it can be connected to both the third floor and the first floor, and can act as a sunshade when the second floor is built.
transcript: 因为在那个地形里面，既可以跟三楼的这个其他的空间连接，又能够跟一楼的这个连接，而且二楼一搭起来之后，它有一个遮阳的效果啊。

translation: This is what we want when designing it.
transcript: 实际上当时是这么来考虑这个设计的。

translation: Ok, let’s just skip over these pictures.
transcript: 啊这个就过一下。

translation: This is a three-dimensional profile of what we have imagined.
transcript: 啊它这是它的整体的做我们做设计的时候呢设想的立体的这个剖面，啊街道的剖面。

translation: It is actually a network system built on the original street for walkers.
transcript: 所以它实际上是做了一个网络的体系，做了一个新的体系，架在原有的街道上，对吧。

translation: This system is designed for walkers.
transcript: 那么这个体系是纯粹的，为步行的身体服务的啊。

translation: When you walk, your body can easily feel whether it is comfort.
transcript: 因为人的步行的身体，你是对这个舒适度是有一个非常强烈的感知的。

translation: Maybe you get tired and want to rest when walking for one kilometer.
transcript: 可能你走个一公里你就会累，你就会想休息，对吧。

translation: And older people want to rest when they walk for a shorter distance.
transcript: 老年人可能走更短的时间就会想休息。

translation: However, such public space and service facilities for pedestrians are very scarce in our city.
transcript: 那么实际上相应的公共空间也好，服务设施也好，在我们城市里面相对来讲都是缺少的，是这么一个状态，对吧。

translation: The secret of streets lies first in our exploration of our body and the possibility of walking.
transcript: 就是说实际上街道的秘密，首先是我们自己对于身体和步行可能的一个发掘。

translation: First of all, our body is extremely sensitive to the walking distance.
transcript: 首先我们的步行实际上就是跟身体相关，步行它对整个的距离是非常敏感的。

translation: And even a little bit longer distance can make it feel tired.
transcript: 稍稍长一点你就会觉得累，对吧。

translation: However, walkers are insensitive to intersections.
transcript: 而且实际上步行，对于交织的路口是不敏感的。

translation: If two cars collide, the consequences may be serious.
transcript: 如果两辆车撞在一起，它们就交叉上了。

translation: But it doesn't matter if two people collide in the street.
transcript: 人跟人碰一下，其实没有什么的，对吧。

translation: Then, we have far more choices when walking than what can be choosen when driving.
transcript: 那么同样的，实际上步行选择的多样化，我们对路径选择的多样化，是远远多于车行的。

translation: From place A to place B, you can choose any route you like.
transcript: 因为在城市里面，人腿长在你脚上嘛，从A点到B点，你可以选择做各式各样，按照你自己喜好的选择。

translation: Chinese gardens are often impressive because of the diversified paths.
transcript: 那么这个时候就会形成路径，实际上我们看到中国的园林，往往也是因为路径的多样性，使得它变得非常地有趣，对吧。

translation: In addition, our body is also highly sensitive to the urban form,
transcript: 还有一点就是说，我们的步行实际上是对于细微的形态，是非常敏感的。

translation: such as the floor materials, the veneer and materials used on the surface and in the buildings.
transcript: 对于地扁地板上的各种材料，对于包括对于建筑的这些呃贴面的、外面的材料啊，建筑物里的材料都是非常敏感的，对吧。

translation: It is easy for us to take a walk.
transcript: 那么还有就是说，整个的步行的门槛非常的小，对吧。

translation: so we envisage that there should be more possibilities for walking networks in the future and we need to create more places in the city that combine with public spaces such as streets.
transcript: 所以未来我们设想，其实对步行的这种城市的网络系统，其实应该有更多的可能性，将它塑造为啊或者说更多的公共的与公共空间结合的地方。

translation: As for street, an important form of public space.
transcript: 尤其是对于街道，这样的一个公共空间啊。

translation: We should explore more to help us walk and make our body feel comfortable.
transcript: 我们觉得它更应该更多的为我们步行，为我们的人本身的身体，做更多的呃考量。

translation: Our imagination for public space is actually rooted in our daily needs and our bodies.
transcript: 我们真正的对于公共空间的想象力，实际上就蕴藏在我们日常的需要之中。

translation: And the possibility of public art also comes from our daily life.
transcript: 那么公共艺术的可能性，也在我们的日常生活之中。

translation: Thank you all!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
